title: France has a new government. Here’s what it needs to do now | PBS News
snippet: The government, put together by newly named Prime Minister Francois Bayrou, includes members of the outgoing conservative-dominated team and new figures from centrist or left-leaning backgrounds.

title: France: 2025, Looking Ahead - L&E Global
snippet: The unstable political situation in France makes it difficult to anticipate future legislative changes in 2025. Following the fall of the government formed under former Prime Minister Michel Barnier, a new government was announced on 23 December 2024 under the new Prime Minister, François Bayrou.
